96080588-d-08-14-96-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT 1501 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING CARS AT THE WEST YARD OF BENSENVILLE YARD WHEN THE ENGINEER WAS ADVISED TO MAKE A WESTWARD MOVE BY THE CONDUCTOR. THE ENGINEER OF 1501 DID NOT NOTICE THE HIGH STAND SWITCH WAS IMPROPERLY LINED WHICH RESULTED IN THE COLLISION WITH TRAIN 512 WHICH WAS ENTERING THE BENSENVILLE YARD VIA THE OUTBOUND TRACK. THE COLLISION RESULTED IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE TO BOTH TRAINS. THE 23RD CAR FROM THE HEAD END OF TRAIN 512, A LOAD OF SODA ASH SUSTAINED DAMAGE AS DID TRE 24TH AND 25TH CARS, BOTH EMPTIES. NONE OF THE CARS WERE DERAILED. UNIT CP 330 OF ASSIGNMENT 1501SUSTAINED DAMAGE BUT DID NOT DERAIL. ENGINEER OF ASSIGNMENT 1501 SIGNED A WAIVER ACCEPTING FIVE DAYSDISCIPLINE AND LOSS OF ENGINEER CERTIFICATE FOR A PE IOD OF 30-DAYS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

PAL035-d-08-23-96-PAL.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train make-up

PAL035-d-08-23-96-PAL.Narrative: AT 6:45 A.M., 4TH PADUCAH ROAD SWITCHER WAS WORKING PENNWALT LEAD AT CALVERT. LOCOMOTIVES WERE MOVING A CUT OF 23 CARS (4 LOADS, 19 EMPTIES) DOWN PENNWALT LEAD. THEY STOPPED AT THE SOUTH SWITCH TO THE#1 STORAGE TRACK TO LET THE BRAKEMAN OFF, THEN PROCEEDED AHEAD APPROXIMATELY FIVE (5) CAR LENGTHS.AT THAT TIME, THE BRAKEMAN TOLD THE ENGINEER THEY WERE ON THE GROUND. THE FIRST OF THREE CARS THAT DERAILED (UTLX 11040,EMPTY TANK) HAD DERAILED AT THE SWISCH, BUT THE COUPLER HELD THE CARS TOGETHER UNTIL THEY HAD MOVED A FEW CAR LENGTHS FURTHER ON, WHEN IT AND TWO OTHERS (GATX 29188,EMPTY TANK; UTLX 130070,EMPTY TANK) DERAILED. WHEN THEY DERAILED, THEY STRUCK AND DERAILED ANOTHER CAR, ACFX 36603,WHICH HADABEEN SITTING ON THE #1 STORAGE TRACK. NO LADING SPILL. NO HAZARDOUS MATERIAL RELEASED. NOPERSONAL INJURIES. CAUSE DETERMINED TO BE EXCESSIVE BUFFING OR SLACK ACTION DUE TO HUMAN ERROR OF ENGINEER. EQUIPMENT DAMAGE=$16,750 AND TRACK DAMAGE=$1,000.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
